pEi67NwFElznHpB-m9CZXg.review_text: were there to celebrate a friend's bday. Drinks are good. Maiden lane was nice also tried a colorless whiskey made of corn...  liked it all

Sg_BvnTHsbc1AABiJjaiPA.review_text: Trendy SOMA bar/lounge with great drinks, and what looks like really good food too.

e5WYxNp7iJGb3HhHb78tYg.review_text: Best truffle tater tots ever!! All around best bar food ever actually. Really loud though, so not the best place if you want to actually talk, but trendy and fun!

w_ziBbBD1Xc7vMKSsKdE6Q.review_text: My bar - for bars - in this area is really not that high, having worked around this same area for 7 years, but this was one of the worst I've seen in awhile. They did a good job with the interior but it's the bad attitude of the staff, the lame happy hour crowd, and the pizza that tasted like cardboard that has me never wanting to come back. Drinks are also mediocre at best.

ZhkOEkOPN3p6O1uOkbMytg.review_text: It's really not fair to review a place before it's official grand opening. I stopped by on a scouting mission for future visits. I was a little bummed out that the truffle popcorn was not available, but I got a free shot of absinthe for my disappointment.  The layout is nice to look at and seems great for large groups. I will definitely check it out later when things are in full swing.

wJgtf18VKKZq9A6ZQUybQw.review_text: I spent a few hours here for trivia a few weeks ago and really came to enjoy the place. It was packed when we first arrived around 7, but we managed to find some seats at the bar until a table opened up. Throughout the night I tried several drinks from their menu which were all tasty, and tried a variety of the food which was also very good. The service was good and they were quick to take care of our group.

2bFJ_32zzj7w84-HAwc3lw.review_text: As a former avid patron of the bar formerly known as Eve, I was a little sad when I heard that the place had shut its doors.  It was home to many happy hours with former coworkers, and it was even the site of a company birthday celebration (with many, many, MANY stories that came from that evening).  With a quizzical eyebrow and a skeptical spirit, I went into Southside and I immediately changed my mind.  The place was remade entirely to where it's...dare I say it... classy.    And of course it was quite fitting that we had our company reunion at this place as well.  Much like all of us, the place has grown up quite a bit.  I'm quite a fan of the Maiden Lane cocktail (not to saccharine or syrupy) and it was great not to be screaming at each other and straining to hear over loud, bumping music that made no sense.   Definitely a fan.  And while I don't work on 2nd and Howard anymore (*tear*) will hopefully make it back out to this place for some more grown-up shenanigans.

OOQmg-zRIQCTwvIqLasc2Q.review_text: Can't peak for their drinks here but pretty damn good pizza!!!! and potatoes and more pizza!!!! Hosted our company events here, friendly servers and bartenders but services was slow hence the minus one star.

2m-c55_NPWVJVuk6XqO3ow.review_text: Hot spot! Great bar, drink selection, and crowd. It can definitely get packed in here, so get here early to grab some space with friends.

303UFSSX6RN-2bgi2Vx_7Q.review_text: Great food and a great ambience!! It was crowded during happy hour, understandably, but we grabbed two bar seats in due time.    I tried the "resurrection" cocktail... It was terrible!! Do not drink it!! I've never had a spicy drink before but this drink tasted like... Hmm, how can I describe it...pepper meets grass.  I did not drink even half of it. If this is what resurrection is like... No thanks, I'll just stay in heaven.   However!! They made a great Moscow mule and I tried my friends tiki drink (forgot the actual name) and it was great! I must not be a big enough cilantro fan.   Anyways.   Avocado salad. Yum! Truffle tots! YES.   I'll definitely be back. Too many delicious sounding drinks on the menu to let one bad seed of a concoction ruin things.

AvC5XQAElcGAAn_Wr5auEg.review_text: This is a gnarly little bar for the Financial District. Not a buttoned-up atmosphere with hipsters touting their finely waxed moustaches, nor are there loud groups of beer-pounding socialites ready for a "party" crowd. It's a bit of a sleepy bar with some cozy booth seating and mean cocktails. My kinda place.   The Ramble On is a fantastic potation. Gin, lime, and a house-made blueberry basil syrup. Oh, hell yes.   Next time I'm in SF, there will be a few visits to this spot. Cheers to that.

4Ya-tjG6q2lMOOHUlwYZ7A.review_text: been here years ago and was not a fan.   came back this past weekend and the place and crowd was definitely a lot better. very eclectic crowd which was nice  maiden lane cocktail -- 6 / 5 stars. loved it moscow mule -- 3/5. needed some more sparkly or something (--) horse -- 3.5/5 pretty decent manhattan -- way strong  definitely coming back to try the food! they had some items that sounded really tasty.

As3PGConLtPOKgfGtAizNQ.review_text: One of my favorite places for happy hour in the SOMA area. They have a really cozy interior, great cocktails, and a good selection of beer. The Maiden Lane is a perfect drink for the ladies, refreshing and comes with muddled strawberries. Brownie points for carrying my favorite beer, Delerium. They also make good flatbread pizzas if you need something to snack on.

pqyokIQMWTudCnDBzVbN8Q.review_text: This is a nice place, didn't get their drinks but ordered the spinach and mozarella salad and it was very flavorful and delicious.

FIDPP65G4FxtZfqt5HwWWg.review_text: Located conveniently close to Montgomery BART station (only a 7 minute walk!), Southside Spirit House is a perfect place for happy hour with friends, coworkers, or even a hot date.  There's lots of bar seating, couches, and wooden tables to drink at. I really dig the vibe here!   - good selection of beer, wine, and cocktails - happy hour from 3-7pm ($1 off drinks) - TVs so you can catch the games - flat bread pizza ($13)  is delicious! - can make reservations for party of 12+  Cocktails are around $11-13. You have to try the Maiden Lane - whiskey, lemon juice, strawberries, and ginger beer served in a cute little mason jar.   Will definitely be back and back again for drinks!

BdMDq5SXlDU07wxErRohTw.review_text: This spot has changed ownership / identity so many times that I'm hopeful that this current ownership will stick around... because they have a good thing going!  Was here for a very dear colleague's "last day at work" drinks... open bar and food... good times!  Ambiance: a lot cleaner and brighter than when it was "Eve" - the one thing I noticed was that they weren't selling sushi / rolls in the front and they weren't refrigerated. See, a good thing already. Plus the decor is modern with hints of the south"   Food: since we were a group ... we ordered a bunch of pizza: happy hippie flatbread... was my favorite! Tasty... crispy and really went well with my Amstel Light (yes I know...)  Overall... since it's just a couple of blocks from work... will probably visit again... but will probably try something other than an Amstel!

HPUqPLc9pP-skR6rAzP9ZA.review_text: Loves this place! So many great spirits and bartender (Jason I think his name was) was awesome! Met a couple locals, had good convos and just a great night! Had their tacos and meh wasn't their string suit but drinks were on point! Can't wait to come back and throw back a couple more shots next time I'm in town!

ooHc7E0HApB4tYWe_s7O0w.review_text: Having southside in your name is not a bad thing for someone who grew up in Chicago's southside. The ambience is loud and gets crowded when the DJ is spinning on a Friday night.  I recommend going there just after midnight when the place is starting to wind down. You can grab a booth or table easily.   They offer a few Japanese spirits like Nikka and Yamazaki. Prices are fair for the area you are in. Nikka 15yr was $25.

5tKmkEZGtz3hGJYSs37Jaw.review_text: I'm really not a bar hopping type of girl. But this bar has to be one of the best one I been to! I dropped by Saturday night with a few friends because we needed a good night out since work has been stressful. Cute bartender that worked Saturday kept giving me free shots all night! Can't remember his name since I was pretty buzz. Everyone there was so friendly.  Pros: Friendly bartenders Good mix crowd And the bouncers was cool with me going in & out to smoke a cig. All in all I'll be back. :)  Cons: No Grey Goose & No Parton :(

jhPAC7UyPiRFNPlNQYMMXg.review_text: First time I came here, the drinks were good and their pork belly sliders were delicious.  I came back, and where did that slider go? It's no longer on the menu. Worst of all, we ordered a couple of drinks.. and both were TERRIBLE. I mean, un-drinkably terrible. I don't mean the "Eww it's a whiskey drink and I'm a girly girl who doesn't like to drink whiskey so I'm going to give this place a shitty review"-terrible, I mean, the drinks were REALLY bad. Oh, and I love whiskey by the way.

pPX0O2_hVr-7Cxkr3zR7Ew.review_text: Just hosted a part of about 30 people last Saturday. I"ve planned many gatherings of all kinds over the years and this is one of the few I've ever hosted where I was able to enjoy the event like a guest.  They did everything and timed everything so well.  I didn't have to check in with them during the event for anything.  First, the events coordinator made the planning so easy.  We met once in person to look at the area we're reserving. Then all food/drink plans were made over email.  The coordinator responded to all my questions in a timely manner and made good suggestions to help my event run smoothly.   They had our area set up even before I arrived 30 minutes before the event start time.  They also did a good job of keeping people arriving for another party to stay in their section (they had a bigger crowd than my group).  That's not an easy thing to do.  During the event, the food came out piping hot throughout the first half of our 3 hour event. Late comers didn't have to settle for cold food.  All the food was delicious!!!  I had been here before just for drinks and thought the food other people ordered looked great.  So I was relying on my "foodie" instincts and hoped the food would taste as good as they sounded.  Flat bread doesn't sound like fancy party food, but SSH made them with upscale ingredients that are super tasty and elevated them to party food status.  Our waitress was "on it" when getting everyone's drinks.  When I checked with a new arrival about flagging our waitress to take their order, she had already gotten it!  Great food, great drinks, great space, great staff = great party, even for the hostess!!!

hf6_tmqkRdBdwlXwUbKyow.review_text: Cocktails were good, but service wasn't that attentive. Would go back and have a seat at the bar instead of at one of the tables...OK

0AZHFsD_dJrA6pgVX-HTyg.review_text: This place is just a great regular ol' bar. Nothing fancy but very familiar feeling. It has a great crowd but you can still hear people and the seating is nice and the bartenders are friendly. I think this is a great way to start the night or a good way to finish it. Either way, its a good time.

r-A0VKZVWhVPwcwfybbAMg.review_text: Came here for the first time on a Saturday night. The interior is open with long communal tables and some couches lining the outsides. It was a little quiet at first but quickly filled up (and for good reason!).  Impressive beer list with beers like Dogfish Head 90 Minute IPA, Stone Arrogant Bastard and Hitachino Nest on tap. On top of beers, I tried the Vieux Kinner (Rye, Cognac, Fernet, Vermouth) which I enjoyed a lot. I tasted some of the other cocktails ordered by friends and those were pretty good as well.   The bartenders and staff were very friendly and responsive. One of the staff was especially helpful and attentive. After some chatting, we found out he was the owner, Colin, just filling in for the night. He is a cool dude - he let us know about the various specials and when there was a mix-up that delayed a couple of our drinks, he comped those drinks. The greatest revelation of the night is that on Saturdays, if you order two cocktails, you get a free pizza. Mind explosion. My memory is a little foggy about which ones we got (one was prosciutto and fig), but they were tasty.   Will definitely be back in some capacity. They have a happy hour with $1 off drinks and a late night Spirit Hour with $2 off spirits / $1 off beer and wine. Southside also has TV's, so it could be a good place to catch a game.   P.S. for the the people commenting on the $13 beer, you probably ordered Hitachino which retails for about $6 for a small bottle. With regular bar markup, $13 is about right.

cCPjASKs5YpMB4BmN2oSZg.review_text: My rating is four stars but I see Southside becoming a five-star bar soon.   Great drink menu at Southside. The prices for beer and wine are surprisingly reasonable. The draft beer list is full of glasses at either $5 or $6. Only one is at $13, if memory serves. Most glasses of wine in single digits as well.   The layout is nice, offering plenty of room for multiple groups, and yet it doesn't feel too big just for a twosome. A few TVs are placed strategically around the bar. Plenty of Warriors fans (yes, this is another Bay Area bandwagon time of year, though hopefully one of the folks will be wearing her own Sharks jersey - respeck!) cheering on the Dubs.   Vieux (spelled viex on the menu) Kenner is a steal at $11 because it tastes good, of course, and packs a punch; it's all alcohol. Get it neat rather than on a big block to taste it chilled and not too cold. You want some flavor to come through.  Closing out the tab wasn't easy if not done immediately when receiving the drinks. Anyway, you may need to speak up, way up, at the bar to get your bartender's attention even if Southside doesn't appear busy. My habit of putting down a credit card only if ordering multiple rounds works against me here. When just buying one round, I pay with cash, unless it's work T&E. Why isn't this more common?

-g3XIcCb2b-BD0QBCcq2Sw.review_text: Stopped in for a few drinks with some friends before they headed out to see the last night of MOMA.  Greg and I passed by here on our way to Thirsty Bear from our home and saw a sign out in front that said "Soup of the Day: Whiskey".  Anyway, we stopped in for a few cocktails and saw that when you order two cocktails on their menu, you get a free pizza!!  FREE PIZZA after ordering two drinks?!?!? ummmm this obviously makes so much sense.  I had the Maiden Lane and my friend had the Gold Rush cocktail.  Mine was served in a mason jar and was definitely pretty potent and strong.  The Gold Rush is served up, and comes garnished with black pepper.  We ordered the Mission Pizza that came with mushrooms and cheese.  All of this makes so much sense, except when it came down to the service.  We had asked the bartender who took our order for drinks if the note on the botton of the menu was true, where getting two cocktails meant a free pizza.  He said yeah, but his reaction was like "UGH. I mean, yeah I GUESS that means you get this."  So, even after saying yes, there was no indication on what/how we order said pizza and we were left sort of guessing about what was next.  We flagged down the second bartender and asked the same question, got a similar response that resembled rolled eyes and heavy sighs, but was pointed to the back of the menu where we could choose which pizza we wanted.  Ultimately we ordered it, it came out, it was actually pretty delicious, and reasonably sized for two people to share.  Naturally our friends caught on to the idea and before you know it, Southside had to pump out 3 more pizzas for our group of friends.  My thoughts on the whole thing: Don't get mad about something that's on your menu, bro.  The most awesome thing here is their cassette tape wall.  Super hipster, but so cool at the same time.  So, the main takeaway here is that the whole idea of this place is good.  The cocktails are priced for SOMA/FiDi, and this free pizza incentive is amazing.  That being said, the attitude of the bartenders here really need to change.  We might be back if we're i the area and in the mood for cocktails + pizza.

AOFDB60pjiXby08lx5HHYQ.review_text: This place needs to update their cocktail menu online. Came for the Hooker boot cocktail and the bartender said he didn't have the right tequila to go with it. However, he made it anyway and warned that it would be spicer than normal,  which was true. It was a little too spicy, but I was warned.. I also tried the Terrence en llamas, not good at all. You should stick with beer here. I did like how they had 2 types of peak's organic beer, which is very hard to find here.   This is a good space to hang out with friends, pretty empty most of the time. There's also board games and tvs. Stick with beer here and you'll be good.

YP5RiJiv0nOpyo0tHYkdwA.review_text: I've been here a couple times and love this place.  The drinks are great, the people are fierce, and there's Jenga! It's a great place to stop by for a Trivia night (yep, they have that too!) or grab drinks with friends.

oSb0E2Yv1I37vHI3LI85tw.review_text: This placed was packed right after work. Fun atmosphere- the little notes on the janga sets on the table were hilarious. Workers were Borderline rude. Drinks were okay. Truffle tater-tots were TO DIE FOR.   Don't judge me: but the Shirley temples were HORRIBLE

f6aKthONslT3IM9KuXDIcQ.review_text: I love this place! Great environment, service, food and drinks! Also, convenient hours of operation!  Good job, you guys!

1Uwp1oEpS2ZkHAmvg3531A.review_text: I like tater tots, watermelon wheat, cassette tapes, and jenga. Even the art is objectively dope. This is a nice place for a person like me.

PktYCUDmn89KXuztq9z9jA.review_text: Came here a few times for drinks and food. Service varies from very attentive, friendly, efficient to down right terrible.   The last time I went, there was only one bartender (and whoever is stuck in the kitchen) and he was so swamped I felt bad for him. Ended up bringing our empty glasses up to the counter for him.

zVprRtAwLEIQerMrvHc7ng.review_text: As far as bars goes, this is definitely one of the best I've been to.   We came on a Monday right when they opened with a friend who was in town from Germany. We had such a good time sitting at the long tables, playing Jenga. All of our drinks were delicious. I had the Ramble On and my husband ordered a whiskey drink. Later I ordered a beer and he had an Old Fashioned, which he says was the best one he's ever had.   Drinks were a tad expensive, but what can ya expect. The happy hour was nice and took a $1 off our drinks. We didn't order any food, but I will definitely come back to this bar.

QTRilFzgTUsGseXmutCv5g.review_text: I went there on a Saturday night and the atmosphere was chill. It's great for big groups (make reservations), not too crowded and the staff was attentive.  Although, other Yelpers complaint about the noise, it wasn't loud at all, but I guess it depends on the night and if there's an event.  A plus was the free pizza with every two special cocktails ordered on Saturday nights and Jenga which was fun to play.  Will defiantly come back to this place..

egJD2P1OgfS2JyHu7uVP1A.review_text: Review based on Happy hour only. This space gets packed! Be prepared to wait a little for some space to open up on the couch or tables. If you sit at the tables you have to order from the bar.  They have some very yummy drinks! I had the resurrection and the tiki torch. Service for drinks is pretty quick. Food was ok. We ordered the flatbread pizza which was basically pepperoni thin crust pizza with arugula and truffle tots. I wouldn't recommend the pizza but def get the tots!

_don8EWxNsvRdjDJqWbw0w.review_text: This is definitely my kind of place! Low lighting, lots of little nooks for sitting and catching up, long bar, and lots of delicious foods and nibbles. I Love this place and it is right around the corner from my place. The bartenders were super friendly and helpful and a stranger even bought me a drink. I do think I will be back...often!

skar1XyXyjTKKUawy-NlyA.review_text: Only been once and for one drink but liked the vibe, the decor and the drink selection.  Nice wall of liquor and some TVs as well, with high wooden counter seating as well as the bar.   Definitely plan to come back to check it out again.

W9RU376D6Ny0GzFKtc7uNQ.review_text: 1/18/2014  To drink: Maiden Lane (dickel whisky, fresh strawberries, leon juice, ginger beer) Ramble On (gin, fresh lime, fresh house blueberry-basil syrup)  The cherry on top was that our 2 drinks came with a whole flatbread pizza for free! (Based on recent Yelp reviews, it seems like this deal has sadly been taken away).  The music was really loud for a bar, so it was kind of difficult to have a conversation, and apparently they couldn't turn it down. Hopefully they fixed this for my next visit!

Kr9sA9gKISX5i8WN4_nXcQ.review_text: Been here a couple of times for HH. Great drinks, it just takes a little while to get them as the place is packed on weeknights after work...but which place isn't in this area of town. So if you're willing to be a little patient, this place is worth it.

FaYXjGgLtetpCCiKmEsq9g.review_text: Why hello there Southside Spirit House! What a nice find! My friends and I would stumble upon this place, way before we would head across the street to Temple SF for a night out of dancing! By far, this place remains as one of my top SoMa bars in the area. Here's the rundown: wooden furnishings, knick-knack paddy whack give me a glass of alcohol, chalkboard specialty drinks, eye candy looking bartenders, and awesome music makes this place a fave of mine!  Experimental cocktails, to-die for pizza and truffle tater tots, and a round of Jenga to kill time whilst enjoying good company you have with you. Best of all, you can't pass up their Jager shot and glass of beer on the menu. Look for it! Oh, don't mind me, but they have Snake Bite beer in a bottle. Trust. It's super delish to drink alongside with a slice of pizza.  Would I come back? Hell to the eff, YES!  P.S. They offer Happy Hour here! Do try to make it out here before heading out to the clubs!

cufhYFdyrUAt4SWe-m0grQ.review_text: I have no idea how I wound up here. It certainly wasn't by my doing. I think my SF world-weary friend sent me in this direction after tiring of listening to me complain about my meal. Ever the old-time friend, he knows that a surefire way to shut me up is to get a good beverage in me. The cocktail of the evening was the Maiden Lane, a delightful blend of bourbon, strawberries, ginger beer, and lemon juice. Yes, I said 'delightful' when describing a bourbon drink. Somewhere in Kentucky, a burly man is anxious to beat me up. This drink would be worth it. Because a.) bourbon and b.) strawberries! Seriously? Yes. It's the perfect blend of tough and tender. Bourbon (just the word, not even the drink) will always be manly but when you pair it with a multitude of muddled strawberries...? Joy. In a glass. Imbibed many many times.  It's a good thing the vibe is so relaxed here. Between that, the drinks and the low-to-the-ground ottoman I was sitting on, upward/forward motion was something that just wasn't going to occur any time soon. Good for groups, come sit and stay a while in a craft cocktail bar that feels like home. Food? I can't say anything about that because 1.) my stomach was already full of bad decisions and 2.) who comes to a bar to eat (and then complains about it)?

AdDRbizanPP8ZmXdE92pJg.review_text: Went to a private party. Cool venue, good music, great bar pizza (a bit greasy on the crust but if it's late and your hungry, why not~), and great sliders (I don't even eat slider but they were good).  Drinks were good. Wine they gave me was meh. I asked for Malbec, perhaps I should start being specific so I don't just get any old wine.   Bathrooms were nice.  (SUPER CRITICAL.)

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: Something missing. In a good way: youtube.com/watch?v=7HNN… In a bad way: Out of homemade fig jam so no Southside Pizza. Wasn't the only thing missing. Ordered the Financial Pizza instead. Garlic oil, squash blossoms, parmesan, mozzarella. Tasted the last one. No idea on first three. Intrigued by the pork belly sliders too. Blueberry hoisin sounded so good. Think we had it. Neither of us could tell. Half our meal was left untouched. Decided to Replate (replate.org) a few bites in. It was an unspoken understanding. Noise was not missing. Almost too loud to talk. Drinks were better. Ramble On (gin, lime, homemade blueberry basil syrup) and Maiden Lane (bourbon, strawberries, lime juice, ginger beer) were enjoyable. Bartenders making them might have woken up on the wrong side of the bed. Menu with clever references and cassette tape wall art had more personality. Not too expensive (food, drinks were at $11) so the biggest loss was time. And perhaps my hearing from the screaming drunk guy. Confused if we were on Howard or Union. Next time sticking with Moby: youtube.com/watch?v=vV0K…

IxqQTUT6QMk6Qr0YgRvyeA.review_text: A great remodel and really cool new happy hour spot in the SOMA.  Their craft beer selection is really unique and tasty.  Their sliders, deviled eggs and steak tartare all hit the spot and I can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu.

hXq_ClOtVoAW7KF8NciQOw.review_text: I wish there were more places like this. The pizza is delicious, the beer and whiskey choices are great and the staff is awesome. Im surprised they were busier. More places need to watch how this place runs.

i2KocsDcufoW5PNi_1LJnQ.review_text: Their online menu is out of date so one of the drinks on it doesn't exist anymore (Hooker's Boot). Bartender was cool enough to make it anyway, but my girlfriend said it was too spicy. I had to drink it down so it didn't go to waste. I liked the Maiden Lane (always support bourbon), but nothing else really stood out for me. There's a lot of seating around, both tables and booths, and the bar is pretty long to accommodate the masses. Kind of pricey ($5 for a Trumer? Damn), and there's not really much else in the area (aside from a loud club), so I'd have this place either be a start or an end point of an evening.

vj-71bWcddq5l-FEkThVbw.review_text: Been adding in SSH to our work happy hour rotation. Been liking their cocktails (Maiden Lane) and they have  "jenga" blocks at the tables.  They should paint them in the chalk paint to let patrons write their own drunk jenga tiles! Anyways, pretty good service here and never too long for a drink. It can get a little crowded but hey that's a good sign.  :D

Mk3Jvy-V931l9gkjoIM80Q.review_text: My absolute, most favorite bar! Staff is always super friendly and attentive. It truly is my real life Cheers. I've had a bad night there....'nuff said.

0VpL7QhUjRzrIkWw1b6LiQ.review_text: On a Tuesday night, my friend and I went in to get drinks. To our surprise they had a trivia game going on. Great atmosphere and good crowd. We had great drinks! Pizza wasn't that bad either. Bartender was pretty awesome!

8alKcHqmVFgip2NNmZb5FQ.review_text: I finally made it in to check out the remodeled bar & I absolutely love SSH. I had been to the old Eve & can say Leilani has outdone herself with the revamp. Everything from the reclaimed wood to the cassette tape wall oozes appeal. It's also much brighter so I can see what I'm drinking & the people I'm with. The vibe on a Friday night was lively, seemed like a good after work crowd. Their location is easy within the SoMa area. Now on to the real star of the joint - the drinks.   SSH offers a fantastic cocktail menu which doesn't surprise me one bit as Leilani knows her stuff in the mixology department. Being the whiskey gal that I am, I opted for the Caged Heat: whiskey, lemon, cardamom, tamarind (grabbed my attention), & ghost pepper. A little spice makes everything nice. This drink was everything I hoped it would be & not sweet. I just can't do sweet drinks. I was also able to sip the Resurrection & Maiden Lane. Both were equally as good as mine.    Unfortunately I wasn't able to try any of their delicious food because we had dinner reservations. I will say that I've heard from a few sources that their food goes beyond bar food & is as good as their drinks. So, I will have to come back & update my review once I've tried the food. If you want a good vibe & tasty cocktail SSH is your place.

XSFC5ZBoKf0M9-bv2UtBHg.review_text: Great new little place, quaint, clean and the staff is fun.  The only negative thing was that they ran out of a lot of beers that I was really interested in trying.  I hope this place picks up and to return again and try some new beers.   Truffle flatbread wasn't bad, a little more dough than I would like, but the flavor was still good.

Iqs_HHc2POcYSUsggm2YBw.review_text: Awesome service with some good beers on tap. Bartenders and servers were still all smiles during a crazy busy happy hour rush. All the praises go to the avocado salad and the truffle fries. Just make sure you take your little cheese pill because both were loaded with shaved parmesan. Around 7:30/8-ish the crowd thinned out and seats were aplenty.

_5uZ9Ur33MnFvpjeryyKMQ.review_text: This place has some downright tasty drinks! I had two of the Ramble On gin cocktails and one Maiden Lane bourbon strawberry lemonade-esque cocktails last Friday and was an extremely happy lush. For those nights that I'm feeling adventurous they also have a few "I wouldn't want to drink another one of these but the ingredient list was too badass to not try it" drinks (a la The Alchemist) that I'm eager to try on a Saturday evening when they have their buy 2 cocktails, get a free pizza promo going.  Now about that pizza...Something about it, I think it was the sauce, didn't taste the way pizza should. As an "eat this so I don't get too tipsy too fast" substance it's fine - but I wouldn't say it's overly enjoyable to eat. The Mission pizza lacked the truffle flavor we all expected (but was heavy on the onion) and the Twin Peaks left everyone -whelmed. Not over, not under, just whelmed. Taste comments aside, I openly admit that the size is decent for the price. I ordered two to share with my table of friends and it was a decent snack for all.  In all, it's really crowded and loud after work but it has a little something for everyone and is worth a visit!

A_sf1IvhZ0KDW1Lnvm6RYg.review_text: Great for happy hour drinks!  They serve mine in a mason jar, can't go wrong with that. I ordered the Maiden Lane (Bourbon, fresh strawberries, lemon juice, ginger beer). Very tasty! Keep in mind, this place gets pretty packed, we came here for HH and there was an event going on so the place was jam-packed. It's a little hard to identify the waiter/ress since they don't wear name tags or uniforms but overall they were accommodating and friendly.   - Good drinks - Board games - Yuppies atmosphere  - Casual HH  Would love to come back and try their trivia days!

tD1a0zdA1UvjBIH7vHKK3w.review_text: Honestly I've had to knock it down a few stars because of two recent experiences here. Due to circumstances I've actually wound up here twice in the last week, and both times the new bartenders were snappy and rude. The first time I came in and tried to order the Dia De Los Muertos- they were out of guava. Then i asked the bartender if he could still make the Hooker's boot (see previous review), and his response was : "I'm new here so I have no idea how to make that." Ooookkaaayyy, can you ask someone? I'm pretty sure I'm not the first/ last person to ask for this drink, and as a former bartender I would have offered to try to replicate it or ask the patron what kind of drink they like. Honestly these SOMA bartenders parade around like mixologists, but a true mixologist would be able to make any drink, on the fly, or invent something equally delicious to make someone happy. Frustrated, I asked for a Trumer...they were out. Finally I got a Kellerwies from Sierra Nevada. At this point my co-worker chimes in and makes a comment about the beer and mr. salty bartender asks if he's tried it. Co worker starts to reply he is from Chico and MSB replies "what is that supposed to mean?" Um, Sierra Nevada is from Chico bro.  Fast- forward to last night. Company happy hour. Our group arrives and someone who was assigned to be our server comes up, introduces himself, and says we can order from him or at the bar. I decide to order at the bar and as soon as I get my drink another salty bartender rudely snaps "you know you have a server, right?" From that point on I ordered from our server (who was really nice btw).  I know I'm not alone in this feeling since others remarked they also had salty experiences here. This place is not going to suffer- there's plenty of tech companies and fi-di firms in the area to keep them busy, but as for the monthly company happy hour we'll be going elsewhere from now on.

s3kRi7b8t2sdtYcsMbqlJA.review_text: crowded and packed for a Friday HH/evening.  Super hot in the back with poor ventilation.

-AEbxWDSB8MnvOv7EwbinQ.review_text: This location was never very good as Eve, but in its second life it is great as Southside Spirit House. I like the woody interior and relaxed feel. Food and drinks here are solid. The staff here is very easy to work with for group gatherings. I was able to reserve the entire long table section in front for my boyfriend's birthday party without any issue. Our group was well attended to and overall people had a great night. I will definitely be coming back here again.

gBFcPEHpQOnAVKAyqoMyzA.review_text: A few friends and I were bar hoping and decided to make a stop at this bar due to my obsession with whiskey! Good vibes! Great people! Great selection of whiskey! Decently priced drinks! Most definitely would be a spot I would go to again when I come to SF in the future!!

8_Hs9Bh5tgFdc_1ycxHChg.review_text: I had one of the greatest times here. There is happy hour, which is posted in chalk on the board.  A group of us were here to watch the Giants world series 2014 game 6. I was obviously expecting a win, which unfortunately didn't happen. My liver, however, was certainly winning. There are about 3 - 4 TVs with plenty of viewing room. Since it was such an important game, there was mostly standing room. On an "off day" there are plenty of tables.  The drinks are great, bartenders are friendly, food is satisfying (pizzas, truffle fries, oh my).  My only negative is that my moscow mule did not come in a copper mug. hmmmmph

VmlShd8k2tq7-O4TVx5R1Q.review_text: IM A FAN!!  LOVE LOVE LOVE this place  Great interior.  Plenty of seating and free reservations on tables for a big group! Just email the contact person listed on the website.   I emailed the HR person and she reserved my friends a great seating area with the couch and tables. Perfect for my friend's bday!  Saturday nights are the best -- buy 2 cocktails, get 1 pizza FREE. Yes, FREE!  Not just plain cheap pizza....more like fancy organic style pizza you can find at Nopa and Delfina!   My favorite was the truffle mushroom pizza. My goodness. the smell of the pizza was so intoxicating that my friends and i just soaked in the smell! SOO good!  definitely coming back here again :)

tGgTIueZy1JNTzQD9rkZLQ.review_text: 05.03.13  Eve revamped itself as Southside Spirit House.  And still remains my fav bar in SoMa.  Original cocktails.  Scrumptious bar food menu.  Renovations that led to a bigger space, complete with high tables and bar stools along the back wall, and TVs with my favorite game on.  It's like you never want me to leave.

RmzQffNQ_GEzHfLB7_aAsg.review_text: Tough to compete with Kate's Irish Bar next door, but it does a good job!!!  Happy hour offers a dollar off all drinks, and check out the Saturday night special for a free pizza with two signature cocktails!

Q2RsDOhzsCBI-F1oOPe6Lg.review_text: Don't hate me cause I'm about to sound like my grandma BUT...DAMN this place is LOUD!   This place is definitely cracking. It's cool atmosphere brings in the crowds by 5pm for happy hour. It echos of people having a great time. They also have music playing starting around 7pm which makes it even louder. I came here with a large group of about 15 people and it was so difficult to converse among my peeps from across our table. I guess I wouldn't mind such a loud atmosphere if I had been expecting it and it was later in the night. I had not been here before and didn't realize it's not really that great for large groups that want to actually talk to each other.   These specialty drinks were soo good and the staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. I had emailed to reserve a table 2 days before and they hooked us up with a very nice, lounge-y table - plenty of seating for a large crowd. I even got a personalized reserved seating label for..."Chanelle." Oh yeah, that's me -Pretty fancy, huh? They even let us pay and/or open a tab individually instead of one large tab. They really go out of their way to ensure you have a great time. Happy hour means you get $1 off your drink. They also have a late night happy hour.   I had saw someone walking around with a copper mug and immediately thought "Moscow Mule." Well, I wanted to have a cool copper mug too so I ordered one for myself. Needless to say it didn't come with the cool mug. Apparently people steal them so if you want the cool cup with your drink (not to take home), you must front your ID at the bar as collateral (which of course I was game for).   Their food menu is pretty amazing. Our waitress recommended a margherita flat bread which is not on the menu and it was probably the best thing That Should Be on the menu.   I'm not sure how often this happens but there was a new, local vodka company promoting their product by giving out free vodka shots (Seven Still of SF). Who can pass that up? Really cool if they promote local companies like that.   Lastly, I could not find this place at first so if you are planning an outing here, it's right next to Kate O'Brien's on Howard at 2nd.

fOQvMmLa9LwjRaV1xuUGPA.review_text: Wow it is NOISY! I guess I just don't hangout at bars very often or something.   The tacos here are those little 3 inch ones but still tasty nonetheless. My sister really loved the pickled jalepenos and the like.   The pizza was great! There was an egg on top (unexpected!) it was a little hard to eat.  Great little beer selection but the house made cocktails are a hit or miss.   What bumps this up to 4 stars is the ample amount of seating. Getting old. I need to sit. Hah.

QA9gkc08ka_fN_G3FppR9Q.review_text: First time here and I was not a big fan from the start. I looked at the selection of beer they had and it was a very weak selection to start off in the first place unless they are more of a strong alcohol type of lounge/bar. The food does not look to amusing either. The beer selection they had as well was pretty expensive which was another thing that was lame. The place inside looks very nice that I have to give to them which I likes the most. There was a weird smell by where I was sitting like old towels that have been used multiple times to clean up a mess. I would not come here again but if you would like to come here to just chill and have a drink then it will not be a bad place to go but just remember to not go to crazy paying for the drinks here since it is a very limited selection and a bit pricy since you can get a shot instead for the price of the beer they sell.

0cZaLvThOfuQa9spTMyv8g.review_text: This place has a very rustic feel, speak easy, old style vibe to it.   They serve some decent finger food and delicious drinks.  Autumn / Winter Old Fashion - Super smooth, with a hint of bitters, and a hit of sweetness, from I believe the maple syrup. I had a black cherry in my drink and I thought it was absolutely delicious.  They have a good selection of beers too.  Tater Tots are yummy, as are the flatbreads / pizzas. The food is a bit on the pricier side, I thought they were worth it!   It can get pretty crowded here. There is bar seating, and a few tables. The tables are more community tables, unless you have a larger group. Come early, come often.  Recommended and I'll be back!

gfyW0vuJls8ARoHmogfcmw.review_text: I was able to park right out front on a Saturday night?? Awesome!   It's very spacious inside, and they have lots of bar top tables that were open.  We ended up at a table with a house made Jenga set, and it kept us pretty entertained during our entire time there.  I was excited about all their cocktails, but I was disappointed when the bartender told me they couldn't customize one of the drinks because they're batched. I feel like a place like this should be making all their drinks individually as they're ordered??  - Ramble On: fresh blueberry, gin, lime, basil - not as sweet as it looks, good for summer - Maiden Lane: also great for summer with fresh strawberries and ginger beer to balance out the sweetness - Resurrection: I like drinks with peppers, so the serrano was great with the kiwi, cilantro, and green chartreuse - Triumphant: whiskey, tequila, with 2 kinds of bitters - Kentucky Stone Sour: the egg white was a little too stiff, but the combination of wild turkey and amaretto was otherwise good - Manhattan: slightly sweeter than I like, otherwise pretty standard  We also randomly added on a truffle pizza.  I know - random, right?  The reason we ended up here was because my friends had come across some free pizza special in the past, but they don't do it anymore :(  The flatbread wasn't amazing, but in the setting of many drinks, it was pretty good.  Drinks were good, but like I said, I would have preferred if they could better customize the drinks rather than batching them.  Otherwise, it's a good low key place.

-lYQUBejX6H18UkNpxUntQ.review_text: I don't care if it's petty - Southside does not make good south sides. MINUS 3 STARS.

TmDaYip-8qSuSIMtYW872Q.review_text: Finally got to check this place out after bookmarking it for some time; since I don't work in SOMA, I rarely make it past Mission street these days, but a crowded Dada was a blessing in disguise as it forced us to make our way over here. Formerly Eve, I was pleasantly surprised to see how much of an upgrade Southside Spirit House is from its previous decor.  Alcohol is clearly labeled by type, with a heavy selection of whiskeys (obvi, especially if it's their "daily soup" afterall!). My friend and I ordered our drinks (Big Daddy IPA and Powers on the rocks, or, rock to be exact), and the bartender promptly joked with us that we had 2 of the most surly drinks ever. Cheers to that.   HH is up until 7p on weekdays and they also serve food. Will need to come back to partake!

YG5EroFMYByZODecz3U_kQ.review_text: Adorable addition to this neighborhood.   Reasons to love Southside Spirit: - the cute signage - the rustic decor - decent drinks - JENGA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Yes, you read that correctly, folks. They have jenga sitting on the tables- made for a different kind of Friday night than what you might be used to. Pleasant change of pace.  One observation: Everyone is unusually short. Very odd. Keep your heels at home if you don't want to tower over the boys.

UtBbJ2bgU-ZoPk6qICUbHw.review_text: Interesting drinks, good atmosphere, and friendly enough bartenders. Sometimes it can get crowded and seats can be reserved leaving you awkwardly standing in everyone's way.

HwCWwx4PXIYJIksZN4MJZQ.review_text: a haiku for southside:  so many whiskeys awesome bartenders and games don't be the dd  thanks to buddy jason h. for the introduction. this will forever be known as the place where i first tried a pour of balvenie 30. pretty much died-and-gone-to-heaven status.

AHz3sGxkZjAzv8uu0Q9hqg.review_text: Whiskey, WHISKEY and more whiskey.  I recommend "the maiden lane".  Cool bartenders, $1 off cocktail happy hours :-) and there is one flat screen tv behind the bar for game watching.  Also, they supply enough random strangers to provide you  with a myriad of factoids for Rutgers football trivia.

aVaa64zb_-d6VTY3XcXyIQ.review_text: LOVE THIS JOINT (5 stars)  The vibe is something else!!!  -FOOD, great bar food with a nice twist -COCKTAILS, pretty, tasty, and strong  -PRICES, fair  -SERVICE, awesome  -AMBIANCE, art and tape wall are cool editions  My close friends are regulars. I frequent the scene from time to time. We been coming here for about a solid yr since the name change. Katherine is one of the best bartenders... I rarely get to see her but every time she knows my drink. I don't need to say what I'm ordering, it'll appear before me. That's great service. We tip her well usually around 40-50%. She's that great.  The foods delicious. I'm a sucker for bar food. Especially when it has it's own twist to it. The pizzas, tater tots, sliders, devil eggs are super yummy. I love chilling at the bar with a cocktail, eating tater tots, listening to the music, and watching mute tv and my homies behind me.  Will I be back? Yes!  JABA APPROVED. Until the next review....

6YoWJRo13IEzaGYf5tgVvg.review_text: DJ spinning 45's.... Funk, Soul, Motown??? I can dig it!!!

4paWpLov6LjpsNNgE1fhSg.review_text: Loved this bar! Forget about stuck up snooty bartenders at other SF cocktail joints. You won't find them here. I spoke to both bartenders that were working the night I was in and both were more than willing to chat about drinks and make recommendations. My favorite of the night was the Caged Heat. I'm a spicy cocktail fanatic and this one hit the mark. I tried 4 other drinks and sampled some friends as well. All of them were excellent. The place wasn't packed and you could actually have a conversation. We ordered a couple pizzas which were excellent and the lounge are couches were a great place for our group to funnel in and out of. Nothing bad to say about this place. I will absolutely be back.

bvQ3ZUWc0LnbesxMtIl16w.review_text: Wet night, warm bourbon.   It may sound like a John Cougar Mellencamp album but what it is, right, is the best partnership since Milo and Otis. Yeah it's hipstery with its fancy-pants artisinal cocktails and flannel-clad bartenders but who the hell cares, and besides what isn't hipster these days. It's all getting too meta for me to keep up with. Just gimme a Fat Guy IPA at 6.5% (at least I think that's what it was called) and when it taps out offer me a more expensive beer at the same price because that, friends, is service. Huzzah!  The Grateful Dead pizza is a monster, not even a carb-loading, meat-sweating machine like myself (form a line, ladies) could finish it. Ugh, defeated.

fqfROIXNBnIOvMkp2We-Fg.review_text: They had me at "Soup of the Day: Whiskey" sign...and when I saw Jenga and Monkeys in a Barrel on their high top tables I was sold. Co-worker and I decided to pop in there for bites and drinks after work on Monday.  We had a great time hanging out/spreading out (as it was pretty dead there) but that gave us a chance to scope the premises: bartenders were so good/friendly, server was sweet even as she got cut at 8pm before we were finished, and the vibe was just great between the music and what was on TV (boo Chargers lost that night).  Love their design/decor plus menu that incorporates the infamous $22 special (shot of Jameson, Hamm beer, one pizza, and shot of Fernet)...wait, it might be now-defunct as this review has been sitting in my drafts for a month+!  Nonetheless, thumbs up.

PVFekEJidqcH3V55HqhIBg.review_text: southside spirit house is a great place to come for a relaxing, chill night with friends. i came here on a friday night and it never got crowded. i love the feeling of this place! it's big and spacious yet still intimate with that i'm-not-really-trying-that-hard-to-look-good-but-­still-do-anyway vibe. there are a ton of comfortable seating options and the decor is pretty cool (check out the wall of cassette tapes on your way to the bathroom!). the drinks here are strong and made with good ingredients like fresh berries. go for the ramble on and the bourbon and strawberry drink. another plus is that there's food here!! the oven was broken when i came so we couldnt order any pizza, but the cheese platter was delicious. OH. and there's jenga. what more do you need?   i can't wait to come back here!

BIPFUKKoPc8AQFSuXGvkOw.review_text: Attempted to visit this location twice. My first visit they earned 3-4 stars. The staff was attentive and managed a large group well.    My second visit they were unprepared for our planned  group and many of us waited outside after they reached capacity.   Lesson: fine with friends if you have a plan B.   edit: Received an update from owner about planned changes to the reservation system. Perhaps they're in better shape now - updated my review to reflect a small group experience.

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text: south beach (soma) location...southside spirit house taking root...mix of bar, food and fun...spacious and mix of large table seating and the bar....$eleven cocktails quite potent warning...$six deviled eggs creamy and delicious...spicy thick cut potato chips and creamy dip $six and heavily seasoned...$eleven corned beef sliders tender goodness and quite flavorful...$nine steak tarter a handful mound...plenty to share, but bit overwhelming for solo...lightly seasoned and tasteful...mushroom pizza scrumptious...dirty pickle juice martini flowing and quite dangerously potent...drinks continuing to flow and being a lush to the end of the night...cheers

TEtzbpgA2BFBrC0y0sCbfw.review_text: My salary didn't increase, but my impression of Southside Spirit House definitely has!  Came here on a Saturday night with friends. It was chill, pleasantly populated and the sun was shining in through the open windows. We ordered cocktails (happy hour 'til 7) and got a free pizza to go along with them (free pizza with two signature cocktails on Saturdays).   The drinks were excellently made. I despise sweet drinks, so I stay away from most cocktails with fruit in them. My friend got a strawberry cocktail and I had a sip, and I have to say it was sublime. It was like tasting childhood afternoons by the beach (I'm from Hawaii). The fruit flavor was excellent and it was not at all sugary.  Of course, I rather liked my whiskey drink.  Pours were huge. They use those Champagne coups I love, however the ones they use are nearly double the size of the ones at Tradition and Rickhouse. And they're filled up nicely.  The mezcal Negroni was substantial.  Onto the pizza, we ordered the one with squash flowers and burrata. It was large; enough for two. The bartender even asked if we wanted another, since we ordered four drinks. We said no, because we were full, but I suspect that is somewhat unforgivable of us.  Anyway, Southside Spirit House (on a mellow night) has won my heart. Highly recommended.

SxMBY64n31UHPjxzIastUg.review_text: I came here for happy hour all my coworkers here last Thursday. One thing you'll notice right away when walking in is that it's LOUD. Like, SUPER LOUD. To the point that when you walk out, you're like "Oh my goodness. I can hear." SO BE PREPARED.  With regards to drinks and food? Drinks are not too shabby (so I heard. I didn't get a chance to drink anything, because I was still getting over a cold). Food? We had ourselves the deviled eggs, Mission pizza, and another ... pizza (I can't recall at the moment, and I can't seem to access the food menu on the website). Pizzas were okay - I found them a bit dry. However, the DEVILED EGGS ARE TO DIE FOR. I could've eaten a bunch of those.  Another good thing about this place is that they have games at the tables (if you're lucky enough to get them). We were playing Jenga the entire evening. I think the group next to us had "Would You Rather?"   I would have to say - everything was good here, except for the noise level. So I would give this place a 3.5.

snI32nf_QziTT1Tk9DgapA.review_text: Love this place! Great atmosphere and amazing service. Also, the cocktails and food are great! Don't miss this place for after work drinks or even a weekend night out!

5yyEpsBAdzb_N4kRG-jxNw.review_text: bartender changed the channel during SportsCenter Top 10. DURING! WTF. the drinks seem ok.  more like.. South Side Suck House.

WDOnjcEOhE00QpMP_M2U0Q.review_text: Great drink selection available - service is good but I've usually been there when it wasnt too full.

C469FeAyiATdaNmgXjZYWQ.review_text: Tastefully lit bar, plenty of room, plenty of liquor, and a full selection of wine and beers.  And the bar is pretty conveniently located for the embarcadero crowd, but also pretty full of company men. Bar space between the wall and the drinks is pretty large, so it's a good place for the crowd.  Drinks are pretty standard in pricing -- got a Moscow mule (in a mason jar, of course) plus a wine and a beer for 23 plus tip.  Four stars for a bartender fully holding her own against the onslaught of a yuppie crowd.

pixNhhD7MstDu0Q0F9QyzA.review_text: Yes! Another great cocktail bar in San Francisco.  What an improvement over the bar formerly known as Eve. This is the perfect bar to hang out with a group of friends.  The newly designed bar features wood paneling and a couple of sky lights so the atmosphere is bright and inviting. The cocktail menu is amazing.  The bartenders care about the drinks that they are pouring.  Our group ordered one of everything and they were all spectacular.  But if you are looking for a place to start, I highly recommend the "Maiden Lane" and the "Ramble On".  If you are more of a traditionalist,  you can't go wrong with the "Vieux Kenner." Check out  the full menu here: southsidesf.com/menu.html This bar is awesome!  Each table has Jenga set up and ready to go.  After a few cocktails, try one of the pizzas.  They are delcious!   If you're searching for a good place to hang out and enjoy a few drinks, don't miss out on the Southside Spirit House.

erEO0r8ByJbtxMdXnpwZGw.review_text: I really liked this place! Tasty drinks, nice bartenders, cool ambiance. I want to come back and try the food next time!

bOzsdIkTveA6glHOOMPpkg.review_text: Solid beer selection....check.  Even more solid collection of brown liquors....check.   Decent snacks for a bar.....check!  Love this spot.  They've got TVs with sports, a casual vibe but a great mix of cocktails, spirits and beers, and decent food.  It hasn't been too crowded when I've been, but a solid crowd.   I've had sliders and pizzas (thin crust) and both are solid and tasty - at least enough to soak up all the whiskey and bourbon you'll slug down.  They had everything I wanted the last time I went with my co-worker - booker's, blanton's....even some old potrero that my co-worker asked for!!  Bartenders are friendly and chill, and they give a solid pour.  I've been several times, and will definitely be back!

H_DAhIymP_8kpu1kw07Xtw.review_text: southside spirit house - a love / hate relationship.  love - whitney (the bartender, pretty much the best), selection of beers on tap and in bottles, delicious cocktails, there is food (and pretty good food at that!)  hate - it's SO loud all the time, trivia nights (where it's even more impossible to hear your friends), you have to wait forever to get a drink when it's packed, and that... it;s ALWAYS packed. sigh.  but despite all that, we seem to come back time and time again (and so do others), so they must be doing something right!

q2q0mZYs9c-iKU4pat31fQ.review_text: Maybe it was a fluke but both of the drinks I had here were super gross.  My bf had been here before and said maybe it was an off night.  I guess I'll have to stick to Trick Dog for my drinks!

r-kJxIYKk52CB_0Erqm8bA.review_text: This is my husband's favorite favorite place to go now!  Great staff,  drinks and free pizzas!  Thanks

pXG9zF5ntNQ_IZ13vzYmhg.review_text: What a cool spot. Came here for a happy hour with friends on Friday. By 5:30 the place was pretty packed. Like many of the new bars popping up around SF the interior has a hip modern vibe with high tables and chairs, plus booths, benches, and stools.  Cocktails are inventive and I love the use of fresh fruit and fun garnishes - especially since they're a good $11 - $13 each. Happy hour gets you $1 off drinks and runs until 7pm.  Food was decent too and I'd describe it as upscale bar food. As your typical starving worker after a long day we ordered truffled tater tots (with parmesan and garlic) - $8 for a small bucket, flatbread pizzas - $15 for 12", and deviled eggs - $6 for 3.   Located on Howard between 1st and 2nd, this place is frequented by the typical FiDi crowd.

gJoykKLFcGtYI7I5HgvS_w.review_text: Hangout spot for the young and rich. Briefcases and sport coats make me tense, not relaxed.   Pros:The staff is laid back and not yuppie-ish. Really nice bathrooms. Drinks were good.   Cons: laptop case were left to 'save' barstools and the crowd screamed venture-capitalist.

lCmvpQfFpdxhbWVM59eUCg.review_text: Great cocktails, really good food.  Really small space that gets seriously crowded and ver loud though.

KU1jpjtvoIlzmKz5MZdZDw.review_text: Loud. Flatbread was tasteless; We got the "mission" flatbread pizza, and to be honest Trader Joe's frozen flatbread pizza which is 1/3 of the price tastes 10 times better!

nbfyMmgqnxXIp7EDqTmkqw.review_text: Went here for a free Howaboutwe for couples date where me and the bf each got a flight of 3 beers (each 4.5 ounces). The service was great- Leleani was a awesome waitress and curtailed our flights to our tastes.Didn't try the food but it smelled good. Lots of big groups here on Friday night- and they were all playing jenga :D

Ks7XjExBwoUReUED3fGP7w.review_text: Finally a decent bar with a brown-liquor selection that's in the neighborhood. The bar it replaced was a POS, so any bar would be a step up anyway.   The cocktails and beers are reasonably priced, and they serve food till well into the night. Late-night drink specials are always a plus.

Hj_GF8MnikDy4BQzf0B8Dg.review_text: They remodeled the old Eve nicely.  It's open, lighter, and more modern inside.  We were able to reserve a table for our group to celebrate a birthday with no $ minimum - love that!  We had 2 options so we opted for the back booth and it was perfect!  Drinks seemed reasonable - they do specialty cocktails and shots!  haha  They serve food too.  The special on their menu is order 2 specialty cocktails and receive a pizza.  Great deal if you ask me.

UbZodqZrEzOpL3GnWCsXmg.review_text: Went for a corporate happy hour. Very crowded for a thursday, but the drinks were pretty good and the pizza was amazing! we ordered the mushroom one and it was really yum!  the bartenders were efficient, which really made the experience a whole lot better.

Hf_U6Izi3plD03f1iiJbig.review_text: This is a great place for the Friday afterwork Happy Hour. It gets a bit crowded after 5:00 ish, but if you get there at 3ish, you and your party can get the seats and play some Jenga. Food is okay... Nothing too special. However the vibe is good, and I always seem to have a good time here.

kF_ugOj5YSafTztODy-8Ow.review_text: Very good place in the soma neighborhood for late night eats, short walking distance from the major hotels like Marriot courtyard , St Regis and the W hotel.   Pizzas and sliders plus deviled eggs and the kitchen is open till 1am. Look for happy hour food and drinks special as well as other food plus drinks combos

E1os0IkyDUO_W9SJBu-L8w.review_text: Really great place to pop in after work! I love their beer selection, and it's always lively on a Thursday or Friday night. Plenty of places to sit (if you get there earlier I guess) and the wait staff is pretty attentive for as crowded as it gets.  The only downfall is how incredibly loud it gets, so conversation with more than three people is difficult, but if you don't mind, this is a fun place to be!  $20 credit card minimum though, so watch out! The prices are certainly great during happy hour, so depending on your drink order it might take a bit to hit that (a good problem to have?).

3cnIyELXdZa9C9nFH5NXtg.review_text: What was once formerly the lounge known as Eve, Southside made a few changes to improve the ambiance.  It much better lit now with much more seating.  The place seems more about hustle and bustle than about lounging now.  Which is great cause Eve always seemed empty to me during happy hours, even with it was fairly busy.    I didn't get to try any of their specialty drinks, but you can't go wrong with Whiskey Neat. The pizzas were good, and we tried the sliders which were decent.    Although I didn't try the specialty drinks and I thought the food was okay, the big winner here is the ambiance.  If you are looking for a place to hangout for happy and have a few drink this is a nice spot.  Service is fairly good and accommodating for the most part.  And they have a couple of games you can play, most notably the Jenga like blocks.    Wouldn't be my first choice for Happy Hour, but I wouldn't say no.

QVeKGhOxb0e77prfXoSglw.review_text: Their bartenders are competent! This is wonderful. They have some very solid cocktails on their menu that are perfectly balanced

9GCCoFw_UHiAHjZ4kygHgw.review_text: All the drinks here are awesome, great selection of top shelf alcohol. I have not had the food , would really like to go back and try some of the menu items looked delicious. My pet peeve though with cool spots like this is : if you are also a BAR you need to have adequate sitting space for BAR PATRONS, not just people eating . I was here for the night before a friend's wedding so we had a lot of people, and it was a Friday and so to be expected there were a ton of other people there and NOWHERE to sit. I think an example of a Bar / Restaurant that does this RIGHT is the Phoenix out in the Mission . There are always places to sit for people just drinking , as well for the dining patrons. I'm elderly basically, I need to sit down

MGPQVLsODMm9ZtYQW-g_OA.review_text: I'm pretty reticent to divulge my fondness for what's become my go-to neighborhood bar, but I believe the word is already out. And anyway - I really should share the love. So fine, here goes!  Within a few blocks from my humble abode, I'm able to indulge in the finest of the couture cocktail movement - Local Edition, Rickhouse, Novela, Bloodhound, and House of Shields are all within stumbling (home) distance and all craft a solid cocktail. But only Southside Spirit House is my everything. It's never too crowded or overrun with fraternity types, the bartenders are cool and kind, and I feel just as comfortable bringing in a group of friends or a date as I do sidling up to the bar, solitary. You can kick it or kick back, depending on your mood.  Unlike a few spots I can think of, the bartenders don't give you the side-eye when you ask for something that isn't featured on the cocktail menu (read: zero attitude). And if you're not boozing, SSH has put together a decent craft beer list including my favorite, Hitachino White, as well as a small but thoughtful wine list.   Hungry? The kitchen stays open 'til 1am every night which has saved me a couple of times... think casual American fare like flatbread pizzas, cheese and charcuterie plates, and sliders.  A great little slice of a cocktail bar that's never let me down!

yiRZCGwzebRM5mnLpYfFqA.review_text: i love a good bar with amazing drinks AND FOOD! especially if you go after work, you want to get a drink but eventually you'll get hungry.. this place in fidi finally offers both! the drinks are amazing. i had the MAIDEN LANE (strawberries + bourbon) in a mason jar - cannot go wrong. it is sooo delicious. they have a variety of food on their menu but the TATE TOTS are amazing! the service can be REALLY slow when they're busy so you have to keep on them to get it delivered to your table. but otherwise a great place that i'll definitely come back to. it is a big space and thus, great for groups too. just get there early so you can get a table.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: The last four digits of Southside Spirit House's number spells L-U-S-H. Any place that has "Lush" in their number, I'm immediately a fan of. Apparently, so are a lot of people because Southside Spirit House was CRACKING last Friday during happy hour! Formerly Eve, Southside has transformed into a low-key bar/lounge with a Western ambiance: wooden furnishings, wooden bar, buffalo paintings, wooden floors and wooden tables (I miss the sultry vibe of Eve). It reminded me a bit of John Colins except with a ton of communal tables and several flat screen TVs. Come to later find out that Southside is actually the sister bar of John Colins (they also owned Eve). Although Southside did away with Eve's clubby-ness, they do have DJs spinning Motown at night. No more hip hop (BOO!) so they'll probably attract a different kind of crowd on the weekends than what Eve use to. All artisan cocktails are $11. During happy hour (Monday - Friday 3 pm to 7 pm), it's a $1 off and during "spirit hours" (Monday - Friday 11 pm-2 am), it's $2 off. Cocktail menu: bit.ly/13m41Ps I got the Ramble On ($11): bit.ly/12k81o0 which is perfect for gin lovers especially if you like blueberries. It was a bit on the weak side for me but then again,  I'm a huge lush and I like my cocktails extra stiff. Sadly, it was too crowded to try anything on their food menu ($6-$12) but they totally had me at Truffle Popcorn, Steak Tartare, Beer Braised Corned Beef and Flat Bread Pizza! I will have to try their food next time especially since the kitchen closes at 1 am; just in time for sloshed eats! Food menu: bit.ly/16sHxlJ Ladies, it's a total cockfest in there with a lot of well-dressed lads. Not that I was looking...just merely an observation. Pro-tip: The tilted mirror above the bar will give you an aerial view of the crowd. Don't get caught creeping now!  ;)

KOV-7eQchJHDWcT_3pFtOQ.review_text: I started coming to Southside so often simply because it's so close to my place, but I really love this neighborhood joint.  The atmosphere is pretty chill (although I've never been right after work, but I imagine it tends to get pretty loud then), and it's great for an weeknight cocktail or a place where you can go that has plenty of seating and where you can actually HEAR your friends.  Love that they have jenga! And on Saturday's, they have a deal where if you buy 2 cocktails, you get a free pizza :)

gjfcfzrYZ0O1xINHtnQKiA.review_text: This bar will light up the night life and lift your spirits during happy hour with $1 off every drink.  Don't forget to try their creative culinary pizzas and sliders.  The Mission pizza with truffled mushrooms or the pork belly sliders are sure to please your palate and satisfy your appetite before you play drunken Jenga!  The staff is friendly and helpful.  Reserve a table or booth for large groups.  Parking is ample on the street or nearby lots.  I'll be back to be spirited away!

9fe41Vmw245Eho1PghHHKw.review_text: It gets pretty packed.  Great drinks, friendly service.   Resurrection - loved Southside Paloma - pretty dang good

_3TzyX5mRpA8Afubqp6g9Q.review_text: Strong 4 star bar/restaurant with the ability to earn another star once I've tried more of their food.    I went here after work with a colleague and I was really impressed by the place.  It is in SOMA and not crowded at all, granted we went on a Wednesday or Thursday night.  They also serve food all night which is great.  You can order up almost any type of whiskey (bourbon, rye, scotch, etc) your heart desires.  They also have Old Potrero Rye which makes it at the top of my list.    They have some perfect sized thin crust pizzas and sliders that make for a great dinner or late snack.  They also have a sign outside that says "soup of the day: whiskey" which gave me a chuckle.  In fact, I think I'm going to go here tomorrow now that I'm thinking about it more.  Cheers!

s16-BUo-orUsELvMu5ocKg.review_text: Terrible, terrible service. So bad, in fact, that I can barely bring myself to say anything nice about the stuff that WAS good. Like the drinks: Holy Ghost, Gold Rush and Maiden Lane are all stellar choices. The Kale Salad was disgusting...way too much dressing that went everywhere, because they served it in a bizarre way. The Mission Flatbread Pizza with truffled mushroom was better, but I could have done without the caramelized onions.   But yeah, bad service. I get that it was really crowded when we went, but they gave our order to the wrong table! And even when we flagged it to the waiter, he deliberately didn't apologize or offer to make up for it, and just gave us a lot of attitude about re-ordering it for us. Seriously?

bTZRdeGbCDw54EgO-VfWTw.review_text: Cool vibe. Not that crowded considering we were there with a rather large group on a Saturday. Be sure to ask about their Saturday night special-buy two signature cocktails and get a pizza. Uhh, yes please!   I placed my drink orders and wasn't told by the bartender about the deal. We found out from our group and waited a while before we could put the order in.The pizzas take forever to come out (there's a small disclaimer about this on the menu, which I appreciate), but they are delicious! I really didn't mind waiting since it is such an amazing deal and we were there to just hang out anyway.   I tried the Grateful Dead and Happy Hippie pizzas. They were both delicious, but I especially enjoyed the former.   As for drinks, I recommend the Maiden Lane.   FYI, $20 minimum for credit card charges.

x7AHfj3UpOn1bFTUW0ZZAA.review_text: Be still, my jaded heart: in one fell swoop, Southside Spirit House has resurrected my love for (somewhat newish) SF bars. First, because of the magnificent female bartender (long dark hair) who was lovely and attentive, even during their busiest (and I second all the Yelpers on the "packed and LOUD" business). Second, because Irish Breakfast tea-honey foam is my new thing (atop Jameson Black Barrel, in the "Tempest in a Teapot" cocktail, for which they've won some award--and deservedly so). Bonus points for offering a nice bar menu, including a pretty great spinach salad with burrata (who doesn't love burrata??), which I opted for in momentary remembrance of this stupid supposed diet I'm on, in lieu of what I've heard are the most amazing truffle tater tots ever.   Despite its propensity to be so crowded and noisy it can be difficult to find a seat or hear the music, SSH manages to maintain its "neighborhood bar" feel with unpretentious service, a decent mixed crowd, and a comfortable open layout with beautifully appointed (not overdone) contemporary-rustic furniture and decor.

a0DwyYWrg4LbrSinWd1Beg.review_text: It was a Monday night, 5:30 happy hour.   I walked in and immediately noticed the wall lined with cool leather upholstered seats. It wasn't too crowded and not too loud. The drink meny was really cool-looking and had some great cocktails listed. I got something with Gin and fresh blueberries that was so good, I had another!  I was elated to see the wall leading to the restrooms covered with CASSETTE TAPES! I found my all-time favorite band up there The Police and promptly snapped a shot and of course got it up on Facebook before I even opened the door to the bathroom.  It's so close to my office, I fear I'll be there more often than I should!   Go check it out, and I'll probably see you there!  PS GREAT service by a nice guy.

x0tmfUam_Jj_NCKKuqomyQ.review_text: This place is just meh.  My friends and I attended the "Hella Smart Trivia Night' every Tuesday.  $6 beers and $13 mixed drinks, whaaaaat?  I thought there were drink specials.  The trivia wasn't all that fun, until the later rounds.  The sound bytes and faces rounds were cool, but questions about science, math, and geography are, like, so elementary.  I also found my governor's mule drink just all right.

y6I7waddCQUpHKelJ9sC2g.review_text: Would've been 4 stars if it weren't for my dismissive bartender.    I arrived at ~10:45pm on a Saturday night, just in the nick of time to claim one of the last 2 pizzas of the night (free with the purchase of 2 cocktails).  From the moment we sat down at the bar, the bartender was cold.  No smile, no water to start us off.  Just working to pay the bills it seemed.  We ordered the Vieux Kenner, the Ramble On, a Happy Hippie pizza, and pork sliders.  When our pizza arrived sans squash blossoms I was devastated because that was my sole purpose for ordering it in the first place!  (I would've ordered a carnivorous pizza otherwise!)  I inquired about the squash blossoms and the chef was like, "I'm sorry, we ran out!  The bartender should have told you when you ordered!"  Figures.  Later on I wanted an Old Fashioned and asked the bartender if their specialty Autumn Old Fashioned made with maple syrup was sweeter than the classic because I dislike sweet drinks.  Her answer?  "I don't know."  No attempt at an explanation whatsoever.  I'm sorry Missy, but it ain't unreasonable to expect you to understand the ingredients your mixing and if you work in the service industry, it's your job to provide some service!      It's really too bad, because the rest of the service was excellent - the chef, the busboy, the male bartender were all great.  The male bartender even offered me a free drink for the lack of squash blossoms on my pizza.    Now finally onto the food and drink.  My Vieux Kenner and Autumn Old Fashioned were both not sweet and overall acceptable, but not complex in flavor.  The Vieux Kenner was light on the Fernet and therefore not very licorice-y, while the maple did not shine through in the Autumn Old Fashioned.  The Ramble on was loaded with muddled blueberries but was otherwise too sweet for my taste -- but it certainly was an excellent girly drink.  The squash blossom-less not so Happy Hippie was topped with fresh, flavorful shrooms and the flatbread crust was excellently crisp and seasoned with parmesan.  Bottom line, the food and drink are all pretty decent, especially for a bar!  In the future if I'm going to spend $11 on a cocktail I'll take my money to the Alembic or one of the B&B bars, but if it's Saturday and I get a free pizza with my drink purchase, I'll be back to revisit Southside Spirit House.  And then maybe I'll get my squash blossom pizza.

7z-Crwkwo3wyngtjFhdJ9A.review_text: I remember stumbling into this bar before it was Southside and leaving immediately after having a car bomb. Nice to see that it's a swanky new bar!  Great location! (Right next to Kate O'Brien's and across the street from Temple/Ki). It seems to always be packed but it isn't too difficult to get a drink. If it is, you can head next door and grab a brewski and wait for the crowd to subside.  What I'd come back for:  - Deviled eggs (yum) - Gentleman Jack - Friendly and attentive bartenders  Another chill bar in the city.

Ft8-GqNzz_c2ptCkn8K_pg.review_text: Dear Joshy, your a jerk.   This place is really cute. Always crowed. I wanted to check it out to see what the fuss was about.   Um...not the service. The bartender was seriously the rudest ever!! I will never come back here again.

AHI4Ew--zYhs0m8npEd65g.review_text: Fantastic bar to meet a friend after work. It's spacious enough but had a good crowd, friendly bar tenders, happy hour specials, fantastic beer menu and yummy bar food. Some strong stuff on tap to be enjoyed :)  Deviled eggs were creamy and delicious.

dm2G-7KcJ_RYjcZMquJ-SA.review_text: Absolutely the WORST cocktail I have ever had!   We both had horrible cocktails and it was super disappointing! We had the goldrush and the claimjumper. Living in this city we're used to really cool pairing of weird and wonderful concoctions that almost always work.....well the cocktails at Southside didnt work. The Claim jumper with beer and vodka was rancid. The after-taste from one sip was just horrific. I cant believe we just paid $20 + tip for 2 crap cocktails.

LlqxdbyKrxylOia4W7Ok8Q.review_text: I normally don't write reviews, but this experience was so egregious that I feel like it needs a special mention. A bar should not serve food if if can't actually deliver.  We arrived at 9:40pm on a Friday night to kill an hour and change before a movie at the Metreon. The good- nice ambiance, busy but not crowded. A fantastic long ceiling/wall mirror lets you people-watch discreetly without being creepy.   Unfortunately the good stops there. The drink we ordered (Hooker's Boot) tries to be everything at once- sweet, smoky, spicy- and ends up being too much and as subtle as, well, a boot to the face. For the price there are much better drinks in the city.  The worst is that we almost didn't get our food. We ordered sliders at 9:55pm. At 10:45pm, the sliders still have not arrived and we need to go to watch our movie. Only after much prodding of the harried waitstaff do we finally get our food- nearly an hour after we ordered them. The bar was busy but not overly so. There really was no excuse for the wait. Either pare down your menu, increase your staff, or simply stop serving food.

E0hnzH2Kx50pYjIOhMxfuA.review_text: Hands down the best Corpse Reviver #2 I have had so far. It was strong, yet balanced with a good range of flavor and depth. I would gladly order this again.   Overall Thoughts  Southside is quickly becoming my go to spot!

1ljLfQwW9E0M3zv6kW0Pmg.review_text: I like Southside a lot.  I'd give them a 4.75 because the food menu is a bit limited, but they produce high quality from that small kitchen.  Drinks are on point, staff is always friendly and courteous, and Happy Hour allows you to enjoy any alcoholic beverage for $1 off

x3vREfxUlq2-41BYTsIkoA.review_text: Loved the drink selection and the music mix was awesome! Lots of great danceable 80s tunes.  We had the all nighter pizza and tacos. Both were tasty.

U7XGOj-5t0HtIhpXvKIPdA.review_text: Although I did not order any of the interesting cocktails or draft beers they have here (I know, it is pretty unforgivable), I do have to say I was pretty satisfied with everything else! The bartenders were very nice (I ordered a Coke and they didn't even want to charge me for it!), the decoration was pretty interesting (with a bunch of cool/odd looking paintings on the wall as well as various cassettes) and the pizza was a killer!  If you are hungry, go for the one called Grateful Dead and you will not regret it! It's on the healthy side (can I say that just because it's got arugula in it?) and was very tasty and pretty crispy. I found the price to be very reasonable too (12 USD, for two people). If you come in with a large group you might wanna sit on the sofa on the corner, which is pretty cozy. The low lighting is also key to create the intimate vibe.   I'd say this is a place for the ones looking for a low-key night of good food, drinks and conversation.

HmK5wAh0RGposz7e4oZaMg.review_text: Good bar, great prices. Can't go wrong.  Gets crowded during happy hours, hard to find a place to stand, but a very goo place to come after work to get away from it all.

Hq7rYeSMBb2x_mMGzGQdXw.review_text: Much better since SSH took over Eve. Brighter, better seating and atmostphere. Still the same-ish good drink selection. I'll keep coming back for that $1-off happy hour!

jqEWsEwAPEnX04o-OKFQ1A.review_text: Must come back to this place! Drinks are strong.  Bartenders are attentive, friendly, fun and entertaining! (Easy on the eyes too!) Decor (imo) is of an elegant cabin, a tad rugged with a hint of posh and a splash of wow.  Bathroom was clean. Good sign.  Didn't order food. Will rate 5 upon my second return, whenever that is. (Soon, I hope)
