aTcai7UJqimgBFR8cxsj6g.review_text: I like this place tho it took me a while to find it!! i am a dummy! couldn't tell from across the street that it was literally right next to O'Brien. Friends told me it used to be Eve and i felt even more stupid, cuz i been here before, duh! The place is about the same, but with nicer decor...loads of photos/paintings scattered around the whole bar. Large chalk boards around the bar area Lots of space to stand and if you were lucky enough to find a sitting area, kudos to you. Came in this past Friday for a quick HH with several friends. It was lovely, no complaint (cept the rain when i left...w/o an umbrella =) Had couple of jamiegingers! More HH here to come!

sCh0qROIFHWGqrwaNUYYiA.review_text: Went here on a Thursday night for happy hour. We arrived at about 630 and they were "at capacity" so we couldn't even get in. I've never been to a happy hour place that actually turned people away. We went to the Irish pub next door for some beers then tried again and were successful at about 9! Cocktails were awesome - loved the Gauge. A bit pricey but in line with SF/NYC cocktail bars.  Will be back if I'm in that area. Be sure to wait til later in the night if you don't want to be smothered.

--5liceGl0PRsGfguFIoyA.review_text: This bar had a great selection and friendly staff. Additionally they have Jenga and Cards Against Humanity to really have some fun. There could be more seating but there is still adequate space overall. Great for a Saturday night outing!

vjwLL41-EOQQkLSonUMdGw.review_text: As a self-titled connois-- fan, rather, of establishments that focus on artisanal, specialty cocktails, I was pretty surprised I'd never heard of Southside until my friend's going away party a month or two ago. Needing to drive home later in the evening, I limited myself to the Maiden Lane and the Ramble On. And while the former was a tad bitter, and the latter a bit too sweet, both were still rather enjoyable.  The crowd here is a fairly good mix of your usual SoMA types, and the ambient noise does get pretty high up there when the place gets packed. And, though the cocktail list and the decor of the place would suggest a venue more akin to a lounge, I couldn't help but get a certain pub vibe the entire night - neither a positive nor a negative, just an observation. A solid 3.5 stars.  ***Accessibility Info***  Venue - While the venue itself is easily navigable, most, if not all, of the tables here were either too low (coffee tables), or too high (bar/counter height). But, if you're only using them for drink placement, then it's not a huge deal.  Bathroom - Accessible!

0xC53lorxczdky49ffeeXA.review_text: Pros:  - It's a bar. Comes equipped with alcohol & seating!! - Reasonably priced drinks. - DJ & room for dancing (although you won't want to).  Cons: - You might die if you drink here.  - $20 card minimum (3 drinks).   Walked in here at 1:00 am yesterday, on Friday night, for a final drink of  the evening because it was close to the Marriott where I was staying.    The venue itself has potential to not suck - there was a mediocre DJ playing, an area for dancing, ample seating + booth seating good for groups toward the back, and an impressive array of liquor behind the bar.  Not surprisingly though, the place was relatively dead (especially for a Friday night) and the people who were there effectively accomplished giving the place a weird, old-dude vibe.  Not feeling it.   The purpose of this review was to lament the appalling and abhorrently irresponsible service I received at the end of the night. Come 1:40 am, the lights lifted and the staff began their efforts to round everyone up. We had already purchased 2 drinks for $14 but needed to order a final drink to meet the $20 minimum requirement.  I asked for a Screwdriver, thinking it would be a drink that we could easily share and consume quickly. The bartender informs me that she can't serve me a mixed drink, but offers a shot instead (I assumed this was due to a time consideration - they were trying to get people out after all). So, I ask for an oj back with my shot. I'm told I can't have juice, as it's been put away (under the bar where it always is? Perhaps you should keep out the items needed to service your customers while you're still open...), but I'm offered a soda back and I concede. This woman is in such an all-fired rush to get people out so that she can get off at 2 o'clock on the dot that she negligently hands me a glass of coke that is hot, un-rinsed, and full of chemical sanitizer. Unacceptable. Dangerously so.

w7RP1MZad3YO7Vjgp3s3Dg.review_text: Cool bar in Soma. Clean, lots of choices for their drinks. Ample seating which provides games for your entertainment. DJ plays cool music and no cover( atleast when I went ). They also serve food till 1 am which I have yet to try and come back to.

lYT057F_gVUbGVlcP6yhEw.review_text: Great late night place to hang out and have some decent food and drink. I socially liked their pizza. Almost the only place around immediate neighborhood that serves good food till 1 am.

q_cYc9EJN1fzV7zwzc6MkA.review_text: This is a great happy hour spot - its casual and a great after work spot. I love whiskey and per the request of the yelpers, I had to start with the Maiden Lane. While I enjoyed it, it was a bit too sweet for me, I let the bartender know my preferences and asked him for a recommendation so he whipped up a whiskey sour for me with some ginger beer. I really liked his concoction.  His recommendation for flatbread was also great! The Happy Hippie comes topped with caramelized onions and big portabellas giving you an extremely flavorful bite.  I'll definitely be going back to Southside for more happy hours!

btgZWY-IciTg4q61saeJ9Q.review_text: This place is poppin' on Fridays after work hours

xUks8PebhAzo2EyaxcuZSw.review_text: Following a huge conference at Moscone, my internal team wanted an easy place to grab a drink and a few bites as our last hurrah, we choose Southside Spirits and could not have been happier. They were easy to work with and able to accommodate a large group without a lot of hassle. The events person Leilani was prompt with a response and easy to work with. Our server, Paige was amazing--never once getting frustrated with our incessant orders for food and drink refills. Amazing customer service is all in the attitude and she was just pleasant and proactive.   As the evening went on the regulars showed up and I felt like it was a cool place, decent crowd in spite of the 2-3 corporate groups taking over the place. This was my second visit and each consistently great drinks, I loved the Maiden Lane.   I highly recommend this place.

3sOgDMKI2LAY-JlE1BZGEQ.review_text: What do you do when Temple won't let you in until Midnight? Head over to Southside Spirit House across the street. Better yet, probably should just skip Temple and spend the rest of your wonderful night here.   I'm getting too old to be going to night clubs, but I still do. I also tell myself I'm too old to eat Pops with chocolate milk, but I still do. What Southside Spirit House offers is a combination of classiness with funsies! Yes, I didn't know what other word to use. Enjoy incredible old school hip hop while sipping on contemporary cocktails while playing Jenga! Yes, yes and yes! I literally could stay here forever.   Although I only had 1 or 2 drinks here for an hour or so, the time and experience I had is enough to make me want to come back here. The drink I had was super unique. I can't recall the name or exactly what goes inside it but I remember it tasting like Tom Yum Soup topped with whipped egg whites. Not the best tasting drink but my friend's fresh strawberry lemonade and whiskey tasted uh-mazing! Drag the "uh" out for a 21 year old blonde girl sound effect.   SSH also had other games like trivia and what not and I didn't stay around long enough but I saw a DJ setting up and what looks like a small dance floor towards the front. If the current music was at all an indication of what to come, I give the music 2.75 thumbs up! Nothing more refreshing than old school hip hop in an era drowned out by fist-pumping electro-spinning raver-friend music.   If you're looking for a relaxing and enjoyable time, head to SSH. You won't regret it!

a5bVNQAqI_oYrHq0oLMGkQ.review_text: Server (curly hair, dark skin- 3pm on a Tue) was so not friendly, never smiled and I felt super uncomfortable ordering from her. If this is the service i will get next time, i will not go to this place.. The Maiden Lane was SO delicious, the seasonal salad and the beef slider were very good as well. Interior and bar areas are modern, cute, nice. I liked it a lot.. except the attitude from the server. :(. boo.

jVaiCNmWOjoI0led5LZuyA.review_text: Crowd is kind of douchey after work hours, but the drinks and bartenders here are spot-on. Maiden Lane, great way to start. Hit up that Dead Reckoning. Craft beer to sober up. Water? Nah. Get the truffle tots. Same difference. Fried potato goodness. Great ambiance with couches, booths, barstools, and tables. The music here isn't bad either. Pretty pricey though, so be prepared to drop a pretty dollar.

DsFreW0_lh4xYnSxHWBwrg.review_text: I love the look and feel of this establishment.  One part hipster  Bloodhound one part sophisticated Rye Bar.  Now I'm a a little bit older and came of age w Kate O'Briens but need a more mature whiskey rye option.  What I like primarily about Southside Spirit House are the concoctions coming from James.  He got a sense of what we were into and made up familiar cocktails w a twist.  I plan to take my colleagues at our little startup regularly on Monday nights when James is there to do tasting of his diverse and delicious concoctions.  Do you like bitters,  do you like Manhattan's, do you like Citris go to James.  He made the evening creative, delicious, and educational as he provided insight to the cocktail mixology.  The flatbread Greatful Dead was delicious  as well.  Covered in fresh arugula and sausage and spritzed w Truffle oil.  A pub version of the NOPA flatbreads but crispier which we loved.  See you on a Monday.

RD6iIhtUpPEE552JNHpIiQ.review_text: Great whiskey selection and Our bartender, Jason was extremely helpful and friendly. The corn beef sandwich wasn't half bad either!

yW-GBoKnzyduaG86Y1NLzw.review_text: My friends were attempting to bring us to Eve...and we didn't realize it wasn't Eve until we went inside. Huh.   This place is HELLA loud, and REALLY crowded. I guess it was also a Friday night, so maybe that added to the extra crowdedness of the place. I LOVE that they had the Giants game on, which made it a little less "after work" and a little more "San Francisco."  Drinks here are pretty strong, and decent. I was swayed by their White Manhattan, and HOLY VODKA batman! This thing was like Vodka on ice, with a splash of bitters.   In the midst of our drinking, my friends (ok, really me) was tempted by their pork belly sliders...so I ordered one. The flavor of it was pretty good, but I wish they seared the belly fat a little longer. I got more mushy lard than that delicious crisp that you can get with belly meat. It came with some pickled veg, which really helped cut the fat.   Overall, I like this place. They had random games (Would You Rather, Jenga, etc) on the tables for fun. I'm tempted by their Tuesday Trivia nights...hit me up if you want to collaborate on a team! And...your musical tastes go toward country, because that is one genre I do NOT know.

y-f2bITIpI5jcbS-K5Racw.review_text: Great bites & drinks! Have had a few get togethers here & everyone had a great time! The flatbread pizzas are AMAZING! I'm a whiskey girl, & they've got some good whiskey drinks as well!

Qoi5TKfZBmSWHtCD0OizFA.review_text: Visited SSH with a small group of friends for post-dinner drinks on a Saturday night after reading about it on 7x7.  Off the top, I'm pretty impressed with this place.  We all ordered various cocktails and beer and passed it around to taste.  The drink I selected, the "Ramble On," was definitely a home run.  (Gin, fresh lime, house made blueberry basil syrup).  Frankly, I could drink it for days.  To our surprise, there was a Saturday night special where you received a free (whole) pizza with every two cocktails you ordered.  These pizzas are sizable (somewhere between a small and a medium size, 8 slices).  They're also tasty, but there was something missing that I couldn't really put my finger on.  I could see how other reviewers have dinged them on their pizza.  But then again, I don't hold it against them as SSH is not really a pizza place.  Lastly, just a heads up, Saturday night is dead at SSH.  Its a great place to go if you want to sit and chat with food.  But if you're looking for a party, go somewhere else.  This place seems more suited as an after-work happy hour bar/restaurant.  Bottom line, as long as you view SSH from the perspective of a nice place to get drinks, have a seat, chat with friends, and munch on a few things to fill your stomach, you'll have a great time.  If you're looking for the next Pizzeria Delfina, go somewhere else.

-HgGrg2UZgKA8iELR4rgEg.review_text: went to an event at the sister bar, John Colins, so when I discovered Southside opened up a few months ago I was excited to finally check it out.   I chose a vodka based drink but was kind of iffy about it. The bartender immediately sensed that and suggested the Maiden Lane, which is bourbon based so you cant really go wrong :) He definitely seemed like he cared about the drinks he made. I was very happy with mine.   I think he mentioned they also serve food after 1am, which is a huge plus on weekends near Soma.   I'll definitely be back with more friends. :)

qIDy9zJfCuqxy6A3exPe_w.review_text: Thank you for opening a new bar in FiDi. I've been so sick of Americano, Prospect, Palomino, Rosa Mexicano. Finally a place that has some charm and isn't pretentious or too divey.  We stumbled upon this bar for my co-worker's going away soirée. It was packed on a Friday at 6pm, but they served food! Thank goodness. The pizza is decent. They have a lot of seating as well. I enjoyed my cocktail and the bartenders were nice.  I'll be back!

fSvOdnryI9FPJ2ylcsE2ig.review_text: This place is expensive.   A small beer = $13 during happy hour. It's a little too trendy for my taste. I liked Eve...more down to earth prices.

EiwxlbR8fb68lMgEXhcWKA.review_text: I'm kind of a huge fan of this place.   I came here for a friends bday party recently and I really, really love it! Aside from the crazy parking situation in this area on a weekend, this place is totally low key, but totally hopping.  I didn't know it used to be something else, but as Southside Spirit House, they serve little bites and great cocktails. They have long tables conducive to large parties, and are cool with you bringing your own desserts and snacks to share. Their cocktails seem pretty reasonably priced for being in SF and they have good service.  It was crowded and happening, but never so crowded you felt claustrophobic. They even have nice bathrooms, very themed ... I liked the ambiance overall and would not mind coming back!

Pg3Q7516riCrzIXvPgGKQQ.review_text: Southside Spirit House's packed with people during happy house. It's kinda of hard to find a table, but there's plenty of tables around. Just gotta stand around a bit and wait for someone to leave.  == Food and Drinks ==  Pineapple express flatbread pizza tasted pretty good.  Maiden Lane and Ramble On. Ramble On is a blueberry gin drink which tasted great. Definitely would recommend the Ramble On. Maiden Lane is strawberry, whiskey, and ginger beer. For some reason, it tasted like cough syrup.  == Service ==  Order at the bar, get a number, and servers will come with the food.   == Overall ==  Great place to hit up for happy hour for a good meal and some drinks.
